messages.message: @Heymian Can you please weigh in on this, we are going to start to onboard additional clients that are very security conscience and if they can see others PI data this is going to cause issues.

@Gilbert Solorzano In that case, a sandbox would really be the best way forward — I don’t think ib.com (http://ib.com) is designed for this use case and we can’t provide these kinds of guarantees for it.
@Krista Hardebeck @Ben FYI on sandboxes for trainings ^
@kunal The sandbox, will be a good solution for net new we still have an issue with ib.com (http://ib.com) where our current client might also discover this issue.

agree with the comments above, instabase.com (http://instabase.com) was intended for single-tenant, sandbox would be the best bet if customers care about isolation. The endpoint to allow returning user info (username and email) and to search for them is public for ease of usability in the UI needs. That being said, we can consider changing up the UX a bit to only search via user names if you’re not a site admin.
